mapping.name: sourceless-disabled
mapping.description: Source-less mapping that is permanently disabled by setting enabled=false

mapping.name: sourced-disabled
mapping.description: Mapping that has a source, and that is permanently disabled by setting enabled=false

mapping.name: sourceless-conditioned
mapping.description: Source-less mapping that is disabled by a condition evaluating to false. The range is dynamically enabled and disabled, based on the condition value (which is false here).

mapping.name: sourced-conditioned
mapping.description: Mapping with a source that is being enabled and disabled by condition in a pre-4.2 way. So "false -> false" is interpreted as "no mapping there", including skipping of the range evaluation.

mapping.name: sourced-conditioned-no-state-properties
mapping.description:
Mapping with a source that is being enabled and disabled by condition in a pre-4.2 way. So "false -> false" is interpreted as "no mapping there", including skipping of the range evaluation.
